thread.title: Westbound I-90 blocked near Four Lakes as crashes and shoulder misuse delay response
thread.title_full: Westbound I-90 blocked near Four Lakes as crashes and shoulder misuse delay response

author: Nick Hawthorne
title: Westbound I-90 blocked near Four Lakes as crashes and shoulder misuse delay response
text:
SPOKANE, Wash. — Updated at 9:51 P.M. All westbound lanes of Interstate 90 near the Four Lakes interchange at milepost 270 remain blocked because of multiple collisions, according to the Washington State Department of Transportation.
Officials said some drivers are traveling the wrong way along the shoulder, preventing emergency vehicles and tow trucks from reaching the crash scene. The Washington State Patrol and at least two tow trucks have been delayed as a result.
Transportation officials said vehicles stopping or driving on the shoulder are slowing efforts to clear the roadway and reopen the highway.
Drivers are urged to avoid the area, remain in their vehicles, keep shoulders clear for emergency responders and use alternate routes while crews work to clear the collisions.
This person, while facing the right direction is backing up on I-90 down the shoulder.
— WSDOT East (@WSDOT_East)
Because travelers are blocking the shoulder for emergency vehicles and tow trucks, it is only delaying the ability to reopen I-90 and get the trucks moved.[https://t.co/gxS3NVKuxm][pic.twitter.com/mJ5ubVK9u6][January 8, 2026]
--
All westbound lanes of I-90 near the Four Lakes interchange at milepost 270 are blocked because of multiple collisions, according to the Washington State Department of Transportation.
Drivers are urged to avoid the area and use alternate routes while crews respond and work to clear the roadway.
Heads up to travelers that ALL westbound lanes of I-90 near the Four Lakes interchange at milepost 270 are currently blocked due to collisions.
— WSDOT East (@WSDOT_East)
Use alternate routes at this time.[pic.twitter.com/63Lv0P2aO8][January 8, 2026]
